intro: Cryptophragmium serrulatum, commonly known as the serrated cryptophragmium, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
